subject: Philosophy
title: What Is Real?
description: A micro-lesson that makes What Is Real? usable.

hook.text: You see a red apple. But 'red' exists only in your brain. The apple just reflects wavelengths.

buildup.text: Philosophers call this the gap between appearance and reality. What we perceive may not be what is.

discovery.text: Kant argued we never access the 'thing in itself.' We only experience our mind's version.

twist.text: Modern physics agrees. Atoms are mostly empty space. Solid objects are an illusion of force fields.

climax.text: Reality may be nothing like what we experience. Our senses build a useful model, not a mirror.

punchline.text: What you see is a story your brain tells you.

quiz.question: What did Kant say about the 'thing in itself'?
options: We can never directly access it
